snippet: The bill, which would rewrite President George W. Bush’s signature education law by returning more control to states and districts, divided the House along party lines.
abstract: Bill seeking to rewrite Pres George W Bush's signature No Child Left Behind education law comes to House floor for debate, dividing legislators along party lines.
lead_paragraph: The bill, which would rewrite President George W. Bush’s signature education law by returning more control to states and districts, divided the House along party lines.

headline.main: Education Proposal in House Could Replace ‘No Child’ Act
headline.print_headline: Education Proposal in House Could Replace ‘No Child’ Act
